definition: to charge with a crime or misdemeanor, to charge (a public official) before a competent tribunal with misconduct in office
examples: After Andrew Johnson, the first president to be impeached, finished his chaotic and disgraceful administration, Grant was the inevitable successor.

definition: to cast doubt on, to challenge the credibility or validity of
examples: impeach the testimony of a witness
The Husby's credit rating was impeached because IRS managers were unable to stop the … computer from generating false information.
A basic rule of evidence permits any witness to be impeached by establishing that she made a prior statement inconsistent with the current testimony.
